author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
Hardening its stand on the India-Pakistan talks, Hurriyat faction chairman Syed Ali Geelani on Thursday warned against “wrapping up the Kashmir issue and ignoring the genuine aspirations of the people.”

“The real stakeholders, its people, haven’t given the mandate to anybody to wrap up the issue,” he said, adding that he was not against friendly relationship between India and Pakistan.

A meeting of the Hurriyat faction, headed by Mirwaiz Umar Farooq, was held in Srinagar on Wednesday. It termed the resumption of the talks “encouraging”.

On the Pathankot attack, a Hurriyat spokesman said: “Whenever there is a serious effort by India and Pakistan to resolve issues, incidents like this have taken place to derail the dialogue.”
title: Don’t ignore Kashmiris, warns Geelani
